Key Match Events: Barcola scored in the 1st minute for France.
Dimarco scored in the 30th minute for Italy.
Frattesi scored in the 51st minute for Italy.
Retegui scored in the 49th minute for Italy.
Raspadori scored in the 74th minute for Italy.
Pre-Game Insights: France will tackle old rivals Italy in the first match of their new UEFA Nations League campaign.
France has been hit by several injuries, but coach Didier Deschamps has called up talented players as cover.
Michael Olise receives his first senior call-up after helping France claim a silver medal at the Olympics.
Manu Kone could make his debut against Italy as Deschamps dropped Adrien Rabiot.
Inter Milan's Benjamin Pavard has been left out, while Ferland Mendy and Wesley Fofana have withdrawn due to injuries.
Loic Bade and Matteo Guendouzi were drafted in but are not expected to start.
Kylian Mbappe returns to win his 85th international cap and needs just two more goals to reach his half-century.
Inter's Marcus Thuram may be favored over PSG's Randal Kolo Muani, with Antoine Griezmann also bound for the bench.
